intro: Syngonanthus ngoweensis, commonly known as the Ngowe's grassveld plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
